sen.j: 院尊（いんそん、保安 (元号)元年（1120年） - 建久9年（1198年））は、平安時代後期-鎌倉時代の院派仏師。
sen.e: Inson (1120-1198) was a busshi (sculptor of Buddhist Statues) of the Inpa (In School) from the late Heian period to the Kamakura period.
Inson (1120-1198) was a busshi (sculptor of Buddhist statues) of the Inpa (In School) who lived from the late Heian period to the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 興福寺で造仏、興福寺講堂大仏師。
sen.e: He constructed Buddhist statues at Kofuku-ji Temple, and the large statue of the Buddha at the hall of Kofuku-ji Temple was created by him.

sen.e: When Todai-ji Temple was reconstructed after an arson attack, Inson was in control of the construction of the parts of the Great Buddha (of Nara), such as haloes.

sen.e: He was loathed by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo because he constructed the about-15-meter-in-height statue of Bishamonten (Vaisravana) in Konoe Province for the exclusion of the Minamoto clan.
